1.ins_en: Change to a Directed Acyclic Graph
1.explain_en: There should be no cycles in the graph, modify any arrow to reverse direction.

2.ins_en: Adjust the pen cap to be parallel with the pen barrel
2.explain_en: The direction of the pen cap should be modified to align with the direction of the pen barrel.

3.ins_en: Modify the line b to be perpendicular to line a at point O
3.explain_en: The direction of line b should be perpendicular to the direction of line a at the intersection point O

4.explain_en: The image should be a red triangle with one angle exceeding 90 degrees.

5.ins_en: Modify to have the line tangent to the circle
5.explain_en: The image should have a line that intersects the circle at exactly one point.

6.ins_en: Align the centers of the two circles
6.explain_en: The center of the green circle coincides with the center of another circle

7.explain_en: The upper left corner of the trapezoid should be an acute angle, resulting in a vertically flipped state.

8.ins_en: Make it a circle with eccentricity 0
8.explain_en: The shape becomes a yellow circle

9.ins_en: Modify the image to showcase the horizontal cross-section of the polyhedron as shown in the image.
9.explain_en: It should be a regular hexagon.

10.ins_en: Modify the shape in the image to form the object that is created when it is rotated around its axis of symmetry.

11.ins_en: Modify the right section to the top view of the left diagram
11.explain_en: The right section should be changed to two concentric circles

12.ins_en: Use shading to mark the common intersection of sets A, B, C, and D.
12.explain_en: The central area should be shaded.

13.ins_en: Translate the function by shifting it to become an odd function.
13.explain_en: The graph of the function should be symmetric about the origin.

14.ins_en: Double the period of the function
14.explain_en: The indices on the X-axis of the function should all become twice their original values

15.ins_en: Modify to a directed cyclic graph
15.explain_en: Change it so that node 3 points to node 0, creating a loop

16.ins_en: Transform the graph of the function by changing all of its values to their negative counterparts.
16.explain_en: The function graph should be reflected across the x-axis.

17.ins_en: Change the complex numbers in the image to their conjugate complex numbers
17.explain_en: The coordinates on the Re axis remain unchanged, while the coordinates on the Im axis should become the negative of their original values

18.ins_en: Double the intercept of the function
18.explain_en: The intercept of the function should become -2, and the x-axis intersection value should become 4.

19.ins_en: Set the mean of the distribution to 0
19.explain_en: The center of the function should correspond to an x-value of 0, while other x-values should be distributed according to the original pattern.

20.ins_en: Multiply the variance of the distribution by 4 times the original.
20.explain_en: The x-value corresponding to the center of the function remains 2, while other x-values are adjusted by 4 times their original change magnitude.

21.ins_en: Modify the image so that the four angle bisectors of a parallelogram intersect at one point.
21.explain_en: The image should be transformed into a blue square.

22.ins_en: Make this graph a connected graph without changing the number of nodes.
22.explain_en: In the image, there should be at least one edge between nodes V5 or V6 and the other nodes of the left graph.

23.ins_en: Transform the graph into a disconnected graph while keeping the number of nodes unchanged.
23.explain_en: At least one node in the image should become isolated.

24.ins_en: Transpose the matrix in the image
24.explain_en: The first column in the image becomes 6,9,8; the second column becomes 7,3,1; the third column becomes 5,4,2.

25.ins_en: Modify the matrix in the image to an upper triangular matrix
25.explain_en: The element 3 in the matrix should be changed to 0, while other elements remain unchanged

26.ins_en: Modify the matrix in the image to a lower triangular matrix

27.explain_en: Change the 0 in the bottom right corner to 1, so that all elements on the main diagonal of the matrix are 1.

28.ins_en: Modify Node F to become a child of Node C
28.explain_en: Node F should be connected to Node C

29.ins_en: Delete certain nodes to make it a perfect binary tree
29.explain_en: The two nodes on the fourth level of the tree should be deleted.

30.ins_en: Delete a node so that G has no sibling nodes
30.explain_en: The H node should be deleted

31.ins_en: Find the length of x and replace the original x in the diagram with its corresponding value.
31.explain_en: x should be replaced with 7 because, based on the angle relationships, this is an isosceles right triangle, meaning the two shorter sides are equal in length, both being 7.

32.ins_en: Change the triangle into a square
32.explain_en: The shape in the middle of the image should be transformed into a square that looks the same as the one on the right.

33.ins_en: Label the angle value of angle A at the corresponding position.
33.explain_en: Angle A should be marked as 60Â°.

34.ins_en: Modify to the case where the centroid, incenter, and circumcenter of the triangle coincide.
34.explain_en: The image should be modified to an equilateral triangle.

35.ins_en: Modify to make two circles externally tangent.
35.explain_en: The image should be adjusted so that the two circles have only one intersection point.

36.ins_en: Mark all the shortest paths that the caterpillar should take to reach the leaf.
36.explain_en: The caterpillar climbs diagonally upward along one side and, after crossing the edge, continues towards the leaf.

37.ins_en: Now fold this white paper once such that point A and point B coincide, and draw the crease line on the unfolded white paper.
37.explain_en: There should be a straight line in the diagram, which is the perpendicular bisector of the line segment AB.

38.ins_en: Delete a node so that node 9 has no descendants

39.ins_en: Fill in the appropriate numbers in the boxes to satisfy the column calculation.
39.explain_en: The box in the second row should contain the number 1, and the box in the third row should contain the number 8.

40.ins_en: Add the circumcircle of the shape in the image
40.explain_en: A circle should be drawn such that all three vertices of the triangle lie on the circle.

41.ins_en: Edit the Venn diagram so that there is no intersection between the two.
41.explain_en: Remove the shading and adjust sets A and B to be tangent.

42.ins_en: Disconnect the edges connecting the node with the smallest in-degree to other nodes.
42.explain_en: Remove the edge from node 0 to node 3, and keep everything else unchanged.

43.ins_en: Modify the vectors in the image to form a set of standard orthogonal basis.
43.explain_en: The second element of the third column vector should be changed to 0.

44.ins_en: Draw all the axes of symmetry for the isosceles triangle in the image.
44.explain_en: A vertical line should be drawn through the center of the image.

45.ins_en: Remove an edge in the graph such that two connected components are formed.
45.explain_en: Remove the edge connecting node 2 and node 4.

46.ins_en: Modify the graph in the image to a complete graph
46.explain_en: Each node in the graph should be directly connected to every other node

47.ins_en: Remove all the leaf nodes in the image
47.explain_en: Nodes A, B, and G should be removed

48.ins_en: Draw the vector resulting from vector a minus vector b in the diagram.
48.explain_en: A directed line segment should be added in the diagram pointing from the endpoint of vector b to the endpoint of vector a.

49.ins_en: Vectors a and b are unit vectors. In the diagram, draw the vector resulting from the addition of vector a and vector b.
49.explain_en: The new vector should bisect vectors a and b, with a length of the square root of two.

50.ins_en: Mark the length of side BC in the diagram
50.explain_en: The diagram should indicate that the length of side BC is 13
